poem:
Title: The Inn of Lost Dreams

In the stark silence of budget hotels,
fragile sprouts of youth reside. 
Councils turn their pockets inside out,
abandoning them to a tiding tide. 
Their needs, aching as the moon, 
served on a cold platter to night's intruders.
A wilted bed of roses,
In the land's forgotten corners, 
dream of the sun, unseen.
The world forgets, but I remember.
